newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish automotive output rises 5.5 pct in April.
newsitem.headline: Turkish automotive output rises 5.5 pct in April.

text.p: Turkey's motor vehicle output slightly rose to 29,699 units in April, up 5.5 percent from 28,148 units in April 1996, the association of automotive industry (OSD) said.
It said car output fell to 18,019 units in April, 3.4 percent down from the same month of 1996.
In the first four months of 1997, automotive output rose five percent to 106,274, while car output fell 5.6 percent to 64,788 units, compared to the same 1996 period.
Four-month output included 26,190 commercial vehicles, up 55 percent from the same 1996 period. The biggest production increases were reported in midibuses with 99 percent and trucks with 72 percent.
Farm tractor production dropped two percent to 15,296 in January-April when compared to the same period last year.
